charges.charge_description: 21:846,841(c)(1), and 841(c)(2): CONSPIRACY TO POSSESS EPHEDRINE WITH INTENT TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE, AND TO POSSESS AND DISTRIBUTE EPHERDRINE KNOWING THAT IT WOULD BE USED TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is committed on Count 1 of the Information to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 168 months; shall be placed on supervised release for a term of three years; shall pay to the United States a special assessment of $100; shall pay to the United States a total fine of $20,000; and shall comply with General Order No. 01-05

charges.charge_description: 21:846,841(c)(1), and 841(c)(2): CONSPIRACY TO POSSESS EPHEDRINE WITH INTENT TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE, AND TO POSSESS AND DISTRIBUTE EPHERDRINE KNOWING THAT IT WOULD BE USED TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Bureau of Prisons for a term of 135 months; supervised release for a term of 3 years under the following terms and conditions: U.S. Probation Office and General Order 318; pay special assessment 100, due immediately; all fines are waived.

charges.charge_description: 21:846,841(c)(1), and 841(c)(2): CONSPIRACY TO POSSESS EPHEDRINE WITH INTENT TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE, AND TO POSSESS AND DISTRIBUTE EPHERDRINE KNOWING THAT IT WOULD BE USED TO MANUFACTURE METHAMPHETAMINE(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Pursuant to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984, it is the judgment of the Court that the defendant, Juan Ramos, is committed on Count 1 of the Information to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 168 months. Supervised release for a term of three years. Comply with the rules and regulations of the U. S. Probation Office and General Order 05-02; A special assessment of $100 is due immediately. All fines waived. The Court orders the underlying Complaint dismissed as to this defendant.
